body: I've observed that folder status is also updated when any file from the files currently processed in that folder has finished its sync.

I can reproduce this in v1.2.1rc2 too.
files are showing up, but no progress bars.

Now, in version 1.2.1 I can see that progress bars are working properly again. 
Thanks and all the best to dev team.

Still no progress bar on large files in 1.3.0 The events with updates come through in the browser console (Google Chrome) but the bars are not displayed. e.g.

```text
          "total": 1172,
          "reused": 0,
          "copiedFromOrigin": 0,
          "copiedFromOriginShifted": 0,
          "copiedFromElsewhere": 0,
          "pulled": 924,
          "pulling": 2,
          "bytesDone": 15493758976,
          "bytesTotal": 19654508544
```

issue.title: The 'Needed Files' modal doesn't display a progress bar

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I'm downloading one huge file and when clicking on `Out of Sync Items`, the modal appears, but it doesn't show too much:

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22799031/70583619-8e199980-1bbe-11ea-8ad4-e840ff0662e5.png)

On the right side there is only a number `734MiB`. Looking directly into the code, there is a progress bar at that position that is shown only in some cases. I forced it to show up and it had meaningful data.

I found that the object describing the file has a property `f.type == 'rest'`. Indeed, querrying `/db/need` returns a single file marked as `rest`. The progress bar would show up only if it was `progress` instead of `rest`. Relevant code:
* [gui/default/syncthing/transfer/neededFilesModalView.html:39](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/325c3c1fa7b8d4b59e3c16057756b679723971d6/gui/default/syncthing/transfer/neededFilesModalView.html#L39)
* [gui/default/syncthing/core/syncthingController.js:610](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/325c3c1fa7b8d4b59e3c16057756b679723971d6/gui/default/syncthing/core/syncthingController.js#L610)
* [gui/default/syncthing/core/syncthingController.js:590](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/325c3c1fa7b8d4b59e3c16057756b679723971d6/gui/default/syncthing/core/syncthingController.js#L590)

I made sure the file is being downloaded.

I suppose `/db/need` should return `progress` instead of `rest`, so this might be an issue with a backend.

Is this a bug? And if so, can I work on it?

---
Syncthing Version: `v1.3.2+33-g5e74e12b-dirty-6044, Fermium Flea`
OS Version: `Ubuntu 18.04 (64 bit)`
Browser Version: `Firefox 70.0.1 (64-bit)`

issue.title: lib/model: Missing queue.Done and reset between pulls (fixes #5332)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: I am not actually certain it fixes #5332 for lack of reproducer, but it's likely the cause: When a file cannot be pulled, it isn't removed from the queue and readded on the next try. And the queue is never reset, so that stays there "forever" (as long as the folder is constantly running). I fixed that instance and added `jobQueue.Reset` that removes everything from queue that's invoked when the iteration is finished - in case the folder is stopped (or I missed something else). And I noticed a missing `changed++` on rename, which is largely cosmetic (as in can't think of an adverse effect right now).
